metadata.title: CVE-2022-0001 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - high
metadata.description:
Non-transparent sharing of branch predictor selectors between contexts insome Intel(R) Processors may allow an authorized user to potentially enableinformation disclosure via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0001` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-23-generic - 5.15.0-23.23
linux-image-5.15.0-23-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-23.23
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-23-generic - 5.15.0-23.23
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-23-generic-64k - 5.15.0-23.23
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1004-kvm - 5.15.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1003-aws - 5.15.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-azure - 5.15.0-1002.3
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-23-lowlatency - 5.15.0-23.23

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.17.0-1003-oem - 5.17.0-1003.3
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.0.0-1006-oem - 6.0.0-1006.6
No subscription required
